body: Abraham and Devang, I had forgotten that the wind rose does not accept data without a Ladybug header on it (nor do any of the other annualHourlyData components).  For these cases, you are right that Julia T's method will not work.  I'll offer one very hacky script that will work for all of these cases: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/F*OBLvkzUL-irgbKMkFIeyNgK2dL9XPQZPmajjgiPfCBfyOysW3DSeiW*hRD8VXt5OtGC1uhZPi4HZ0CPnJX3kTrYVtWOgZL/ChrisWindAnalysisPeriodMethod.JPG)I agree that it would be better to integrate this into the components somehow.  I could see you hourList input working well, Devang.  We'd just need several checks to make it compatible with the other inputs like the analysisPeriod. -Chris
